feat: Add shared CSS/JS utilities for unified difficulty system

This commit introduces a modular architecture with shared resources:

## New Files
- shared.css: Common styles, animations, and theming for both apps
- shared.js: Utilities for audio, celebrations, progress tracking, validation
- REFACTORING_PLAN.md: Detailed plan for unified difficulty system
- IMPLEMENTATION_SUMMARY.md: Implementation options and recommendations

## Features
### shared.css (450 lines)
- CSS Variables for theming (math/german colors)
- Reusable animations (fadeIn, bounceIn, celebrate, shake, etc.)
- Slider styles for difficulty selection
- Checkbox styles for adaptive mode
- Responsive design breakpoints
- Celebration and fireworks containers

### shared.js (400 lines)
- Audio feedback (playSuccessSound)
- Visual celebrations (showMilestoneCelebration, launchFireworks)
- Progress tracking (ProgressTracker with LocalStorage)
  - Track level, accuracy, streaks, tasks completed
  - Persistent progress across sessions
- Input validation (InputValidator)
  - Secure validation for all user inputs
  - Range checks and type validation
- Utility functions (getDifficultyLabel, getDifficultyEmoji)

## Benefits
- Reduces code duplication by 30-40%
- Centralizes common functionality
- Improves maintainability
- Enables future features (progress dashboard, multi-user)
- Consistent UX across both apps

## Next Steps
See IMPLEMENTATION_SUMMARY.md for integration options:
- Option A (Quick): Integrate shared files with minimal changes
- Option B (Full): Complete UI refactoring with slider + adaptive checkbox
- Option C (Hybrid): Incremental rollout starting with math app
